thread.title: 'Restaurant Impossible' targets Whitehouse Station Italian eatery, ambush-style
thread.title_full: 'Restaurant Impossible' targets Whitehouse Station Italian eatery, ambush-style

author: Vicki Hyman | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: 'Restaurant Impossible' targets Whitehouse Station Italian eatery, ambush-style
text:
'Restaurant Impossible' targets Whitehouse Station Italian eatery, ambush-style Chef Robert Irvine Comments 
"Restaurant Impossible" star Robert Irvine is in Whitehouse Station this week tackling La Casa Bianca — La Casa Bianca in Whitehouse Station, get it? — for an upcoming episode of his makeover show. 
Irvine's show returns for a 12th season Oct. 22 at 9 p.m. on the Food Network, and this time, all the interventions will be ambush-style, without any contact with the owners before Irvine walks through the door. 
"I've got to tell you, it's not like any other 'Restaurant: Impossible' we have ever, ever done," he says in an interview on the Food Network website . "It's exciting. It is gripping. It's chilling. It's nail-biting. And you'll never know what's going to happen, 'cause every turn is something different." 
RELATED: NJ's Tom Bury makes 'Restaurant Impossible' a reality 
In the interview, Irvine reveals that Italian restaurants (like La Casa Bianca) are the most likely to fail, "because, you know, their mom tells them they can make gravy or sauce, depending on where you come from, they're great with people, and they should open a restaurant. And for the first six months, it's great, because we invite all our friends. Then they realize the bills are mounting up." 
La Casa Bianca's current menu is pretty standard red sauce Italian — baked stuffed clams, pasta fagioli, fried calamari, chicken cacciatore, rigatoni alla vodka — with fairly generous reviews on Yelp . The episode is tentatively scheduled to air Dec. 17. 
Vicki Hyman may be reached at vhyman@njadvancemedia.com . Follow her on Twitter @vickihy . Find NJ.com/Entertainment on Facebook . You can also check out her podcast TV Hangover with co-host Erin Medley, in which they discuss Sunday's debut of "Teresa Checks In," The CW's growing cache of great shows, and the return of "Fargo": TV HANGOVER, EP. 5: 'Fargo' returns, 'Crazy Ex-Girlfriend' rules and Teresa Giudice is back NJ.com TV critic Vicki Hyman and super fan Erin Medley talk top TV news, discuss returning favorites "Fargo" and gush over "Crazy Ex-Girlfriend." Play along to "Name the Show," then get caught up on the latest "Real Housewives of New Jersey" special. Subscribe to the podcast on iTunes or Stitcher .
